bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R. Hart Phillips, November 21, 1952

div1.p: Hench writes that he is anxious to find the service of a Cuban photographer to document the dedication of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R. Hart Phillips, November 21, 1952
div1.opener:
November 21, 1952
Mrs. R. Hart Phillips
Havana Office
New York Times
Havana, Cuba
My dear Mrs. Phillips:
div1.p:
I hated to bother you with my previous request dated November 5, but as
time is getting short I must make some arrangements about a photographer
to help me out. I cannot spent much time after my arrival hunting for a
photographer.

If you have been unable to contact Mr. Aldo Diaz (and I wouldn't be sur-
prised) could you give me the name of a photographer who might help me out
on two occasions. (a) Take a number of photographs for me during the
dedication ceremony at Camp lazear and (b) spend one or two hours with
me, either that afternoon, December 3, or the next day, December 4, at
Camp Lazear taking close-ups of the bronze plates, medallions, etc., the
idea being that I can buy these films, bring them back home, and make
numerous prints of each to send to the various “yellow fever personalities”
including relatives of the original volunteers and members of the U. S.
Yellow Fever Commission.

If you cannot help me, I would just appreciate a word to that effect and
I will make inquiries through one of my Cuban medical friends. I do
greatly appreciate your help.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
